did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Modern Woodmen of America Local 13195 Cash Account Book, 1908-1914
did.physloc: State Records Center - Archives Annex, Library of Virginia
did.origination: Modern Woodmen of America Local 13195 (Cumberland County, Va.)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Modern Woodmen of America Local 13195 Cash Account Book, 1908-1914. Local government records collection, Cumberland County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from Cumberland County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Modern Woodmen of America was a fraternal organization founded in 1883 by Joseph Cullen Root, an Iowa businessman, to provide financial services, life insurance, and opportunities for fellowship for men ages 18 to 45.
Cumberland County was named for William Augustus, duke of Cumberland, third son of King George II. It was formed from Goochland County in 1749. The county seat is Cumberland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Modern Woodmen of America Local 13195 Cash Account Book, 1908-1914, records in chronological order amount received from the camp's clerk to go into camp's benefit and general funds and the amount paid from both funds.
